ACT
8
Legal heirs
Based on the law, the decedent inherits all his descendants, his adopted children and their descendants, his spouse, his parents, his adoptive parents, his brothers and sisters and their descendants, his grandparents and their descendants, and his other ancestors.
On the basis of the law, the decedent's common-law partner also inherits, who is equal to the spouse in the right of inheritance. An extramarital union in the sense of this Act is considered a life union of an unmarried woman and an unmarried man that lasted for a long time and ended with the testator's death, provided that the prerequisites required for the validity of the marriage were met.
The persons referred to in paragraph 1 of this article inherit according to the order of succession.
The heirs of the immediate line of succession shall exclude from the inheritance the persons of the further line of succession.
